title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 803.12 - Requests for hearings on applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 803.12 - Requests for hearings on applications

State Regulations
(a) Request for hearing. Within 15 working
days after notice of the filing of an application, any affected employer or
employee may file with the commissioner, in triplicate, a request for a hearing
on the application. (b) Contents of
a request for a hearing. The request for a hearing shall include: (1)
a concise statement of facts showing how
the employer or employee would be affected by the relief applied for; (2)
a specification of any statement or
representation in the application which is denied, and a concise summary of the
evidence that would be adduced in support of each denial; and
(3)
any views or arguments on any issue of
fact or law presented. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
803.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
